rounds.title: Insurance Fraud Detection
rounds.description: The claims team can only review ~40% of claims. Fraudulent claims are slipping through and costing the company money.

rounds.scenario_key: Customer churn at a subscription app
rounds.title: Customer Churn at a Subscription App
rounds.description: Monthly active users are stable, but cancellations are rising. Executives want proactive retention.

rounds.scenario_key: Late deliveries in an e-commerce warehouse
rounds.title: Late Deliveries in an E‑commerce Warehouse
rounds.description: On-time delivery has slipped below SLA. Ops suspects bottlenecks in picking/packing and carrier handoffs.

problem_single.question: Choose the best statement of the business problem:
options: Build a machine learning model to classify claims.
The company is losing money because fraudulent claims are not identified efficiently.
The claims team reviews 100% of claims but still misses fraud.
Data scientists want to try XGBoost.

goals_multi.question: Select all appropriate business goals:
options: Reduce financial loss from fraud
Prioritize investigations on likely-fraudulent claims
Lower model training time on laptops
Improve precision/recall on fraud flags

model_single.question: Pick the most appropriate analytics solution:
options: Classification model to score each claim for fraud likelihood
K-means clustering to segment providers by specialty
ARIMA time series to forecast monthly premium revenue
Linear regression to predict claim payout amount only

question_items.text: We have historical claims labeled as fraudulent or not.
The business has a workflow to act on flags (claims investigators).

plan_single.question: Which belongs in the analytics plan for this problem?
options: Define the business problem, questions, data needs, model, evaluation, and deployment
Pick the most popular algorithm on Kaggle and tune it until accuracy is 99%
Hire more claims adjusters to manually review all claims
Purchase more servers for training
